name: AYMARA COLLECTION black/white
description:
Our Aymara bath linens are classic and exciting.  Inspired by vintage Aymara textiles often characterized by contrast stripes along both selvages then embroidered to create another stripe variation. Handwoven and embroidered by artisans in Guatemala. 100% cotton. Machine wash; tumble dry low.

AYMARA EMBROIDERED TOWEL/BLANKET
with braided loop
size: 40 x 55

name: MAYA CHIEF BLANKET poppy/ turquoise
description:
Vibrant poppy accents turquoise, chocolate and cream stripes. MAYA CHIEF was inspired by the classic Phase I, Navajo Chief Blanket reinterpreted in an exciting, unexpected color combination.  Simple, straight forward stripes handwoven in cotton. 
Named to honor the people who weave and sew the resort collection to life--Guatemalan textile artisans, ancestors of the ancient Maya people. 

MAYA CHIEF is a part of our new Resort collection of 100% cotton fabrics, pillows, throws and bed covers. Pillows are sewn in New York City. Throws and bed covers are handmade in Guatemala by skilled artisans. 

DBC130 MAYA CHIEF BLANKET
available sizes: 60x60 throw and 90x90 full/queen bed cover
colors: poppy, turquoise, brown, cream
fiber content: hand woven, 100% cotton
dry clean only

Fabric hand woven and embroidered by artisans in Peru. Pillow fabricated in New York City.

name: IBADAN PILLOW 22X22
description:
Made from a vintage Nigerian aso oke tapestry; at least 60 years old.  "Aso Oke" translates "high cloth".  Traditionally a man's decoration, the tapestry was worn on special occasions.  
Please note since the fabric is vintage, some areas show wear, adding character to the piece, reflecting it's history and significance. Fabricated in New York City.

This piece is part of our De Loin Collection, an ever-changing offering of one-of-a-kind and limited edition pillows made from fabrics found around the world.

DBDLP 
colorway: tans, grays, blues, off white
100% cotton front, linen backside
10/90 feather down insert
dry clean only

name: ABUJA PILLOW 21x21
description:
Vintage Nigerian Aso Oke tapestry made of narrow (approx. 4") hand woven  panels sewn together.  We deconstruct the tapestry and sew them into pillows.  "Aso Oke" translates "high cloth".  Traditionally a man's decoration, the tapestry was worn on special occasions. 
This piece is part of our De Loin Collection, an ever-changing offering of one-of-a-kind and limited edition pillows made from fabrics found around the world.
Please note since the fabric is vintage, some areas show wear, adding character to the piece, reflecting it's history and significance. Fabricated in New York City.

DBDLP 
colors: white, aqua/turquoise, subtle silver metallic
cotton & lurex front, 100% linen backside
10/90 feather down insert
dry clean only

name: ASABA PILLOW
description:
Purple, gold and silver metallic lurex create beautifully unexpected pillows available in sizes 10x20 or 15x23. Made from a vintage Nigerian tapestry; at least 60 years old.  "Aso Oke" translates "high cloth".  Traditionally a man's decoration, the tapestry was worn on special occasions.  
Please note since the fabric is vintage, some areas show wear, adding character to the piece, reflecting it's history and significance. Fabricated in New York City.
